page.title: 05Crab fishing
page.content: Six of us went to Kingswear to visit a fisherman and his crabbing boat.First he showed us some big crabs which were hanging over the side in pots.He told us that crabs live on the rocky bottom of the sea,up to 6 metres deep.Then he showed us his boat.We saw where they cook and the bunks for sleeping.We saw the compass and the radar screen which shows the bottom of the sea.There are 2 radios to call for help.When the boat is at sea,the crabs are left in pots underwater.Then they are moved to large containers of sea-water,covered with a metal grid,this keeps the crabs fresh.The fisherman sells his crabs in France and Spain.He took us on a trip to Dartmouth Castle in the boat which is 50ft long and comes from Jersey.He only likes to go out in good weather. He gave us two crabs to take back to school which we boiled and ate.
